comment: run and hide. do not take her atleast online that is. she was present for the first two weeks of class then fell off the face of the earth. her tests are awful and do not even follow with what she has been telling us to study. ended up having to fight for my grade with the department head! avoid the hassle

Professor Richardson ROCKED. She loves teaching and wants her students to learn and succeed. Her lecture notes are available online and her tests come straight from them. She makes class fun and makes you want to be there.
One of my favorite professors at KSU, she is very intelligent and explains the material very well and in an interesting manner. Very approachable and overall a great Professor!
Dropped her. Rude when I asked for help. Try to avoid. I'm a 3.0 student who failed 2 of her tests after studying 2 hours for both. Not very understanding or forgiving prof.
She was very professional and treated everyone with respect. Her tests did not truly reflect what we learned but she kept it pretty interesting.

Very young and intelligent professor. She will usually lecture from a word document that is posted on Vista after class. Attendance is not mandatory however I would recommend it as she elaborates on everything. 3 Exams and a final which she gives you study guides for w/ pages from the book to find the answers so buy the book! Would take her again!

Young and professional. You should buy the book it is VERY useful. The lectures and power-points aren't the most entertaining in the world. She does have entertaining class discussions and group work. Tries to engage students. Gives study guides. Know your definitions. Good teacher who cares, if you fail it is your OWN fault for not participating.

Acts superior and haughty. Would not explain concepts and just expected you to understand the info without explanation. She is rude and treats everyone like a stupid child. A guy in the class who is a little off she treated like a pariah. She should be fired for her attitude and inability to handle anyone who is not of her level. Run for the hills!
Very boring class! uses mostly power points. Not worth the effort for only 2 hours.
A lot of work for only two hrs
Good teacher. The power points follow the book sequence exactly. The tests were easy to take if you A)read the book also or B) you studied for a couple of days before the test. Not hard class at all.

She is young and cool but professional and doesn't tolerate nonsense. The discussions are very engaging and fun. She provides great PowerPoints and study guides. If you use those, you will get an A. Outside of the exams, she only gave one quiz & 1 writing assignment on the Haiti earthquake. She is an awesome professor. You'll love her class.

SHe is a great professor and very nice. Her discussions are fun and the class is not too hard. The powerpoints are really nice if your read the chapter before hand. SHe does give pop quizzes but they are not hard it is mostly vocab from the chapters.

She is an OK professor....you need to know whats in the book AND whats on the powerpoint..gives pop quizzes which i HATE...especially if you forgot to read the long chapter before hand...so make sure you read the chapter before class....gives very specific midterm and final study guides which is nice...takes forever to post grades which sucks

Prof Richardson is a very nice teacher. She is young and cool. We have class discussions about the topics as she is lecturing. It was a very fun and interesting class. She gives random pop quizzes over what you were supposed to read in the book. The tests are very tough... you have to know your stuff and study. Gives midterm and final studyguides.
